intro: Cynoglossum vernale, commonly known as the spring forget-me-not, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple flowers, which are typically arranged in clusters at the ends of its stems. The plant has hairy, ovate leaves that are often arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along streambanks. Cynoglossum vernale is a herbaceous perennial that blooms in early spring, adding a splash of color to the landscape during the early part of the growing season.
